content.text: Are you already tired of endless political debates that lead nowhere? Of politicians just attacking each other while nothing gets solved? And maybe you're even considering staying home in the next election.
We understand that. We see how politics has distanced itself from the daily concerns of people like you.

And that's why we decided to take action once and for all. We don't have famous faces or media protection, but we have something far more valuable – determination and the ability to truly change things for the better.
We're coming with a new approach

items.text: We clearly identify problems that trouble us all.
We offer concrete solutions with measurable results.
We communicate openly, without empty phrases and political tricks.

content.text: We're not career politicians. We're people who share your concerns because they're ours too. We don't have big sponsors or political mafias behind us, but we have the courage to speak the truth and truly bring about change.

You might think that some changes aren't possible, that "those above" won't allow it. But that's a huge myth. You are "those above". It's enough when you stop voting for puppets and start voting for real change.

While many initiatives have emerged that didn't turn out as expected, you still have a choice: you can continue voting for those who just ride the wave of stagnation, or you can try change. And when you convince others too, you'll change more than you can imagine!
Our motto: When there's a will, everything is possible!

FAQ.C: Typical question after reading our program, which usually appeals to absolutely everyone.
FAQ.A: We're not politicians or activists by profession - we're independent, working people who feel a bit rebellious.

FAQ.C: Difficult question that we never primarily asked ourselves, because we don't feel like being on any political side.
FAQ.A: According to independent assessments, Centrism or Radical centrism fits us best. We see ourselves as a party of common sense.

FAQ.A: Our goal is for the state to function systematically and intelligently. We want to kick-start GDP growth and citizens' trust in the state.

FAQ.Q: How do you plan to implement your program goals?
FAQ.A: Simply! If we get into parliament, even in minimal numbers (10 MPs) we can be a key swing vote in a very polarized parliament. In this position, we can then push through our program points.

items.text: Even small help has great meaning!
Share us and follow us on Facebook.

chapters.name: Affordable housing for everyone within a year!
chapters.howName: How? We'll tax owners of empty properties.

content.text: We all see how quickly apartment and rent prices are rising. For many of us, owning our own home is becoming increasingly unattainable and rent is eating up an ever-larger portion of our salary. This problem troubles young families, seniors, and working people - simply most of us. It's time to change it!

Did you know that according to the latest census, we have 860,000 empty apartments in the Czech Republic? That's a huge number! And we have a plan for how to return these apartments to their original purpose - housing for people.
What will we do about it?

items.text: We'll specifically tax owners of empty properties to increase motivation to rent them for housing to people who are looking for a home.
We'll simplify and speed up building permits.
We'll work toward returning to normal, where people lived in apartments, stayed overnight in hotels and accommodations, and worked in offices.

content.text: Our goal is clear - within one year we want to increase housing availability by 20%.

chapters.name: 25% reduction in electricity bills
chapters.howName: How? We'll reduce regulated distribution fees.

content.text: The Czech Republic is almost completely dependent on imports of gas and oil from abroad. Electricity is the only energy source that we can produce ourselves.
Therefore, we must maximally support its production and efficient use, so that it becomes the most accessible primary source for households and companies.
What will we do about it?

items.text: We'll review regulated infrastructure payments and increase competition in electricity distribution.
We'll introduce a free minute market for buying and selling electricity.
We'll support individual solar electricity projects and energy storage systems.
We'll give everyone the opportunity to store and sell electricity according to current rates.
We'll maximally support nuclear energy including experimental mini-reactor projects or thorium utilization.

content.text: Our goal:

items.text: Stabilize electricity prices and reduce total energy costs for Czech households and companies by 25%.
We want everyone to be able to actively influence their electricity expenses and for the Czech Republic to strengthen its energy independence.

content.text: Our goal is to simplify and adjust the tax system:

items.text: Align VAT rates to two clear levels - 20% and 10%
Increase the basic income tax rate to 25% for incomes over 2 million annually.
Reduce corporate tax to 15 percent to support business and competitiveness.
Unify excise tax on alcohol for all alcoholic beverages according to ethanol content.

content.text: Why we want this:

items.text: Systematic and rounded tax rates make planning personal and corporate finances easier.
Fairer distribution of tax burden between citizens and companies.

chapters.name: TRANSPARENT BREAKDOWN OF YOUR TAXES
chapters.howName: How? Electronically and with exact amounts.

content.text: You pay taxes, but you don't actually know exactly what you're contributing to? How much of your money goes to pensions, housing allowances, or the presidential office? It's time to change this.
You have the right to know where your money goes.
Our goal is for every citizen to receive a clear electronic statement once a year that clearly shows:

items.text: The exact amount of their paid taxes, or received state benefits.
Detailed breakdown of how much of your money went to specific areas (police, education, ministry operations, etc.).
In a format that an average ninth-grade elementary school student would understand (no professional accounting terms).

content.text: Why we want this:

items.text: It's your right to know how the state handles your money.
It increases citizens' trust in the state.
In the digital age, it's technically simple and inexpensive solution.

chapters.name: Radical reform of outdated education
chapters.howName: Motivate children to be active and schools to manage efficiently.

content.text: "School should develop children, not stress them"
The current elementary education system is outdated, complicated and unsuitable for the needs of children, parents, or the future of our country. It's time for change!
Our goal is to create a modern elementary school that:

items.text: Develops truly needed skills.
Motivates children to learn.
Makes life easier for families.
Manages independently and efficiently.

content.text: What we want to change

items.text: In the first level, focus on 6 key skills (4 years)
Text comprehension (Reading).
Manual dexterity (Writing).
Foreign language basics (simple communication in English).
Logical thinking (Mathematics).
Sports (Physical education).
Social skills (Playing social games).
In the second level, focus more and explore (4 years)
How to speak formally in Czech.
How to read and write in a foreign language.
How mathematics describes the world (Physics).
How to improve faster in a sport I enjoy.
How to develop more skills that come most naturally to me.
End of grading
We'll introduce a skill level system.
Emphasis on individual progress of each student.
The goal is to "know how", not "get an A".
School as an activity center:
Combining education and interest clubs in one place.
End of complicated commuting between activities.
Time savings for families.
Fair financing:
Fixed amount per student for both school and interest activities.
Independent school management.

content.text: We want a school where children learn with joy and parents have time to enjoy their children instead of solving school problems.

chapters.name: World Cup football final by 2050
chapters.howName: Direct support for training children. End of functionaries.

content.text: Would you also like it if we played a leading role in the World Cup again? Do you remember how our parents showed us and instilled that sport is beautiful and healthy? It's time to return to these values.
Those who train children in their free time deserve real support, not bureaucracy.
Our goal is to support sport for children and youth directly:

items.text: Eliminate unnecessary bureaucracy and redundant institutions in sport, for example the National Sports Agency.
Introduce a system where each sports organization receives a fixed amount for a child's participation in a sports program or training.
For young athletes, the amount will be smaller but appropriate to their needs and training intensity.
For each age group, the same amount will be divided equally among all athletes.

content.text: Why we want this:

items.text: Supporting sport from an early age leads to a healthier lifestyle for the entire society.
Money will go directly to children's sports activities, not to civil servants' salaries.
Equal distribution of resources will ensure that even smaller sports get fair support.
A strong sports foundation is the path to future success on the international scene.

chapters.name: Finally fair pensions
chapters.howName: As much as the economy is stronger, pensions increase by that much.

content.text: The search for a pension system has become an eternal political topic. They like to talk about it as a perfect solution that coalition and opposition must agree on. But deep down they know it won't bring them any political points, so they'd rather buy voters with various promises.
In reality, the pension system already exists - working children pay pensions to their parents. It's time to just formalize this natural system and anchor it in the constitution.
Our goal is to create a fair and sustainable pension system:

items.text: The total amount spent on pensions should correspond to a fixed percentage of GDP (e.g. 8.5%)
Distribution of the amount among retirees is calculated according to paid contributions (with interest) to pension insurance, including payments from their raised children since they've been retired.
The lowest 10% of calculated pensions are increased to the level of the retiree at the 10th percentile.
The highest 10% of calculated pensions are reduced to the level of the retiree at the 90th percentile.

content.text: Why we want this:

items.text: With GDP growth, pensions will be automatically indexed without the need for constant political interventions.
The system reflects the reality of intergenerational contract - children take care of their parents.
Limiting extreme pension variations ensures solidarity and dignified aging for everyone.
Clear and constitutionally anchored rules mean an end to political games around pensions.

content.text: End the endless debates about TV and radio fees. We pay for roads, schools, and hospitals from the public budget, why not for public media? It's time to simplify the system.
Public media are needed in a democratic society, but the way they're financed needs change.
Our goal is to create a fair and stable system for financing public media:

items.text: Abolish license fees and transition to financing from the public budget.
Minimum and maximum amounts for public media should be based on annual GDP (e.g. 0.1%).
Approval of the final amount would be subject to budget submission by public media each year.
Maintain the oversight role of the Council for Radio and Television Broadcasting.

content.text: Why we want this:

items.text: System simplification - end fee collection and related administration.
Fairer financing - all taxpayers will contribute, not just those with TV or radio.
Greater transparency - clearly defined budget approved each year.
Maintaining media independence through legally established financing method.

chapters.name: End price fraud in supermarkets
chapters.howName: We'll introduce strict rules for food chains.

content.text: Are you also annoyed by marketing tricks that supermarkets try on us? Like price tags above or below, highlighted prices without actual discount, or discounts stated from regular price that isn't regular? It's time to change this.
You deserve honest and transparent prices without manipulation and deception.
Our goal is to introduce uniform and transparent product labeling system for large food chains:

items.text: Uniform price tags with predefined background color for discounts and regular price
The price tag will only show the name, final price and price per unit.
Percentage discount may be shown, but font size cannot be larger than price per unit.
Discount is calculated from the lowest price in the last 30 days from the start of discount and products can be labeled this way for up to 14 days.

content.text: All prices will be controlled by a unified system to which prices are sent before each sales day.
Changes in composition or weight of products will be considered new products and must be clearly (in color or with prominent notice) indicated on packaging.
Why we want this:

items.text: End deceptive discounts and marketing tricks that confuse customers
Real transparency helps consumers make informed purchasing decisions

chapters.name: Prison reform - work ennobles
chapters.howName: Prisoners must earn their freedom through honest work.

content.text: On one hand we have low unemployment and total shortage of workers even in the most basic professions. On the other hand overcrowded prisons that cost the state considerable money, plus more lenient courts that don't want to burden them so much. It's time to change this.
A prisoner should repay their debt to society not only by loss of freedom, but also through work and financial compensation.
Our goal is to create a graduated prison system connected with work obligation:

items.text: Establish that the punishment a prisoner serves to society is not just loss of freedom, but mainly financial, and both these punishments must be fulfilled
Create different levels of prisoner comfort - from the lowest level for those who refuse to work, to the highest allowing home stay with restrictions
Create 8 levels of prison system that will motivate prisoners to participate in work and gradually move to higher levels
Allow serving sentences in the form of house arrest with work obligation for less serious crimes

content.text: Why we want this:

items.text: Solving two problems at once - worker shortage and overcrowded prisons
Reducing costs of the prison system and their partial compensation through convict work
More effective prisoner rehabilitation through work habits and responsibility
Fairer system where punishment corresponds to offense and willingness to repair caused damage

chapters.name: General referendum as democracy safeguard
chapters.howName: This should have been here for 30 years!!!

content.text: As the classic says, "democracy isn't a perfect system, but it's the best we have". And because it's not perfect, there should be some emergency brake. It's time to give citizens a real tool to control power.
A constitutionally anchored national referendum should function as a safeguard that ensures the voice of the people is heard even outside elections.
Our goal is to create a national referendum system with clear rules:

items.text: Every citizen can propose one change or join some question for change
If any topic gets more than 1.5% of votes, it will be included in the referendum question list
National referendum must be held no later than 1 year from including the question in the list
Voting is only about change, not about confirming current status
For approving change, one of the criteria must be met with participation of more than 1/3 of registered voters:
50% or more of registered voters will vote for change
Ratio of votes for and against change will be 2:1 or higher

content.text: Why we want this:

items.text: The system ensures that significant changes are approved by a real majority, not just an active minority
Citizens get a real tool to influence the country's direction outside election periods
Referendum allows citizens to correct bad election decisions that become apparent shortly after elections

chapters.name: Drastic reduction of drug crime
chapters.howName: How? Criminalize possession of very dangerous drugs.

content.text: We have a permitted drug called ethanol that's freely available and to which huge numbers of people are addicted, and also huge numbers of people die from it. At the same time, there are banned substances that are far less dangerous from a health perspective than alcohol.
Current legislation creates a dangerous black market and drug anarchy. We need a rational approach based on facts, not moralizing.
Our goal is to set drug policy according to real danger of substances:

items.text: Legalize and strictly control availability and market of substances that are less addictive and health dangerous than alcohol
Introduce strict regulation for production, distribution and sale of legalized substances
Strictly ban any possession or use of other illegal narcotic substances
Use revenue from controlled market for prevention and addiction treatment

content.text: Why we want this:

items.text: Drug crime will be better fought because police forces will focus on truly dangerous substances
Fewer drug addicts thanks to better prevention, control and treatment availability
Available legal substances will have controlled composition, reducing health risks
The state earns considerable money on excise tax, which will be invested in healthcare and prevention

chapters.name: Rewarding politicians based on results
chapters.howName: Reward dependent on real economic growth and debt reduction.

content.text: Rewarding politicians... Why do we pay them for presence and not for results? If a politician does their job well, results come within medium-term years, but they may not be in politics at all by then. It's time to change this.
A politician should be rewarded for long-term contributions to society, not just for time spent in office.
Our goal is to create a fair system for rewarding politicians:

items.text: Set basic politician salaries as multiples of average wage established at the beginning of the year
After the end of electoral term, pay rent for 10 years to politicians who participated in successful voting on changes
Rent amount will be calculated from GDP growth higher than average growth for the previous 10 years
Abolish politicians' ability to decide about their own salaries and rewards

content.text: Why we want this:

items.text: Motivation for politicians toward long-term solutions instead of short-term populist steps
Limiting political obstructions and supporting cooperation on the best solutions
Transparent reward system tied to actual economic results
End endless debates about politician salaries, which will be tied to objective indicators

chapters.name: The civil servant is your employee

content.text: The civil servant is your employee, not the other way around. Yet we often feel powerless when we have to deal with state administration. It's time to change this.
As citizens and taxpayers, you have the right to quality services from those whose salaries you pay.
Our goal is to create a system for evaluating civil servants directly by citizens:

items.text: Introduce a simple evaluation system after each contact with an office (electronically or in person)
Overall evaluation of civil servant will have direct impact on their financial compensation
Transparent publication of evaluation results on office websites
Rewarding above-average rated civil servants and penalties for those with below-average ratings

content.text: Why we want this:

items.text: Improve quality of state administration services and more friendly approach to citizens
Motivate civil servants to better performance and customer-oriented approach
Strengthen citizen control over state administration functioning
Real accountability of civil servants to those they should work for - citizens

chapters.name: Reduce people in execution by 50%
chapters.howName: How? We'll set maximum annual interest and debt amount per individual.

content.text: The Czech Republic has over 600,000 people in execution. That's an enormous number showing a systemic problem. It doesn't pay for many people to get out of execution and they'd rather work under the table.
We'll help people who mostly caused their problems themselves, but their situation was also worsened by creditor behavior or imperfect laws.
We therefore want:

items.text: Set maximum annual interest on actually borrowed money or collected amounts
Set maximum collectable amount per person in execution (excluding fines or caused damages)
Set minimum amount that must be paid monthly on executions if person is not in insolvency proceedings
Simplify debt relief system and make it accessible to all who have genuine intention to resolve their debts

content.text: Why we want this:

items.text: We'll return hundreds of thousands of people from gray economy back to legal job market
We'll limit predatory practices of some creditors and prevent endless debt growth
We'll increase state tax revenues thanks to people returning to legal employment
We'll enable people in execution to have dignified life and chance for new start, which benefits entire society

content.text: Our goal is to reduce the number of people in execution by 50 percent.
